dialogue.utterance: I've been using an e-reader lately, and I find the convenience of carrying so many books in one device amazing.

dialogue.utterance: Absolutely, the portability factor is undoubtedly excellent. I love being able to switch between genres easily, no need to lug heavy books around.

dialogue.utterance: However, I do miss the tactile experience of turning physical pages. There's something special about the feel of a real book.

dialogue.annotation: That's a fair point. Yet, I appreciate <aspect_04> features like adjustable fonts and built-in dictionaries </aspect_04>, which <opinion_04> enhance reading accessibility </opinion_04>, <rationale_04> allowing people with different visual abilities to enjoy literature.</rationale_04>

modality.caption: demonstrating adjustable font sizes on an e-reader

dialogue.utterance: Tablets have revolutionized the way we consume information. Their portability is unmatched.

dialogue.utterance: While the user interface is great, the battery life leaves much to be desired. It's often too short for heavy use.
